title: 20+ Smooth Jazz Fonts for Jazzy Designs
description: Jazz fonts are considered a cool type of font as there are various methods of improvisation with such font designs. Let us find the best Jazz fonts available.
author: Jacob Cass
byline: Meet our expert writers and contributors
excerpt: Jazz fonts are considered a cool type of font as there are various methods of improvisation with such font designs. Let us find the best Jazz fonts available.
text: If you’re on the lookout for all of the best jazz fonts, to elevate your design game, then you’re in for a win! Jazz is a form of African American music that forms within the scope of improvisations. Similarly, Jazz fonts are basically handwritten fonts that have music symbols and chords in them.  Jazz music is the base of various other music genres like pop, blues, and rock. Jazz music has the quality of different rhythms, polished harmonies, and last but not least, the scope for improvisation. A jazz band consists of various musical instruments like bass, guitar, drums, keyboard, and lead vocals. Jazz fonts are considered a cool type of font as there are various methods of improvisation with such font designs. If you are interested in spice up your typography, go through our posts on the best bohemian fonts and best california fonts. Top 10+ Smooth Jazz Fonts for Creative Designs Any font that has the scope of improvisation in them is a Jazz font. The following is the list of the best Jazz fonts available. Feel free to dive in and find out the details to help you continue creating stunning designs. Let’s make some Jazz Oldiez Greatsby Kip and Val Ecustic Jocker Jazzbury Zurika Quincy Jhons Skulrock For the complete list, scroll on! Also see Best Smile Fonts, Best Hipster Fonts, and Top Disney Fonts UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Download all the Jazz Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! 20+ Smooth Jazz Fonts for Jazzy Designs 1. Let’s make some Jazz  Let’s Jazz. Image Credit: Amazon Let’s Jazz is a playful jazz font that draws inspiration from iconic American advertising. This font has been created with the idea to pay homage to the dazzling graphics of the past. The result is this jazz typeface font that provides a condensed look with a bouncy beat. Let’s Jazz will give a voluntary vibe to this amazing genre of music. This font has been created with powerful attention to the contrasting look of Saul Bass’s graphics. These graphics are ever-green and compelling. There are two versions of the same font: The regular and the stamp. Each version of the font contains 450 glyphs and covers several languages in the Latin alphabet. The jazzy experience is expanded with the OpenType Support for small caps. These fonts include beautiful alternate ligatures but old-style retro-style fonts. This font can be widely used in various design projects like headlines, packaging, logos, badges, and more. There is a bonus collection with various examples that are also included that will help you with the design projects. This font style consists of .OTF, .AI, and .PNG file formats. This font provides multilingual support to central, eastern, and western European languages as well. There are OpenType feature standard and discretionary ligatures, alternates, and small and capital letters with old-style numbers are also included. All the additional characters are also PUA encoded. The additional character of this font can be copied directly from the FontBook of Mac and Character Map of Windows and pasted into your favorite text editor. 2. Oldiez Oldiez Font Family. Image Credit: Envato Elements Oldiez Font Family is a retro vintage, classic, old-school jazz font. This is a hand-lettering font style. This font is the perfect choice for your branding invitation cards, labels, clothing company, vintage style font, etc.  This is a sans-serif font style that comes with six types of fonts. The various types of fonts are Oldiez Regular Sans, Oldiez Italic Sans, Oldiez Bold Sans, Oldiez Crack Sans, Oldiez Regular Serif, and Oldiez Gradient Serif.  All the above said types consist of lowercase, and uppercase letters, numbers, symbols, punctuation characters, and multilingual support.   3. Greatsby Greatsby. Image Credit: Envato Elements Greatsby Typeface is a vintage serif display jazz font that is motivated by the retro-style novels of F. Scott Fitzgerald. The font style includes file in .TTF, .OTF, and .WOFF file formats. This font is the perfect choice to promote vintage-style design fabrics, cosmetics, etc. The font style includes letters, numerals, punctuation marks, and symbols, etc. The extras of this font must be downloaded separately from Envato Elements. 4. Kip and Val Kip & Val. Image Credit: Envato Elements Kip and Val is a new font swirly deo. This is one of the Jazz fonts that is apt for romantic designs.  This font consists of some pleasing ligatures and seductive swashes that are the perfect combination to spice up your existing or new designs. The seductive swashes can work as an addition to the already existing alphabets and make them look attractive.  The font set comes as the regular style and alternative style font. Both these styles come in .TTF and .OTF file formats. There are commercial licenses, instant downloads and free updates available with the font. 5. Ecustic Ecustic. Image Credit: Envato Elements Ecustic is a graceful-looking script jazz font. This font set belongs to the calligraphy style of fonts. The font looks great on greeting cards, branding materials, business cards, quotations, posters, and much more.  The alternate characters of this font type are divided into various features such as stylistic sets, stylistic alternates, contextual alternates, SWASH, and ligatures. You can access the OpenType feature via design softwares like Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign, Adobe Photoshop, Corel Draw, and MS Word.   This font set is a PUA-encoded font so that you can access the alternate characters.  This font set comes in the .OTF and .TTF file formats. It works on a PC and a Mac machine. The font provides multilingual support as well. 6. Jocker Jocker. Image Credit: Envato Elements Jocker is a retro-style Serif jazz font. Jocker is the consequence of the bold retro American and European Sans Serif letters for advertising. This font set is the ideal modern type font that you can draw from scratch. There are more punchy details and layered variations available for color use. This font type belongs to the old-age Serif font family that is perfect for logos, greeting cards, quotations, branding, typography, envelope lettering, etc. This font can also serve for coffee bean advertising, packaging covers, labels, pamphlets, old-age wine bottle labels, etc.,  This font is ideal for hand-drawn designs, DIY projects, and any art/design modern-day project that looks excellent and contemporary. There are a total of eight styles in this font type. They are Regular, Extrude Left, Extrude Right, Extrude Bold Left, Extrude Bold Right, Outline, Shadow Left, and Shadow Right.   7. Jazzbury Jazzbury. Image Credit: Envato Elements Jazzbury is a vintage-style classic script jazz font. It is perfect for any calligraphy design or lettering logo.  The font style is suitable for any design needs. They can work for logos, posters, quotes, book titles, websites, blogs, and any letterings or tags. This font is a perfect choice for sporting brands, hospitality industries, restaurant menu cards, and poster cards. This font comes in lowercase and uppercase letters, numerals, and punctuation marks.  There are alternate lowercase letters and discretionary ligatures with this font type. The font set comes in .OTF and .TTF file formats. There is also multilingual character support for the font. 8. Zurika Zurika. Image Credit: Envato Elements The Zurika typeface draws inspiration from the letters from the Swiss city of Zurich with long, lovely strokes that look appealing. The letters of these fonts end with beautiful curves. This is a quirky and playful handwritten design and is apt for large sizes to show off the fine details of each letter.  The font set comes in both uppercase and lowercase letters. The traditional uppercase and lowercase letters also come with ascenders and descenders, which helps the designer mix the letterforms for many more design options. The design of the alphabet in this font style is a mixture of unicase style.  9. Quincy Jones Quincy Jhons. Image Credit: Envato Elements Quincy Jhons is a bold classic jazz font that comes with rounded corners and gives you a sense of nature and human touch in each letter. The attitude of the font is bold that comes in a seductive way. The big letters of this font make the reading ability apt for the font,  It makes a huge impact for beginners.  The font is the perfect fit for the display font. It can work for logos, headlines, large billboards, introductory pages of magazine covers, YouTube thumbnails, and typography.   The Quincy Jhons font can be paired with a simple sans font as they work great within a tape system to draw attention and give the design an authentic personality. This font family comes with .OTF, .TTF and .WOFF file formats. The font set comes with numbers, and punctuation marks and gives multilingual support. The font works great with PC and Mac machines. The font can be accessed from design softwares like Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign, Adobe Photoshop, and MS Word.  The characters in this font set are also PUA encoded. The PUA-encoded characters of this font is fully accessible without any additional software. 10. Skulrock Skulrock. Image Credit: Envato Elements Skulrock is a hard display typeface jazz font. It is a decorative piece of font that works for music album title covers, CD covers, fast food menu cards, and cover pages of rock concerts. This font is an ideal font for branding projects, wedding designs, social media posts, advertisements, product packaging and designs, watermarks, invitation cards, etc. This font is an apt one for any project that needs a handwritten touch.  Skulrock font comes with .OTF, .TTF and .WOFF file formats. The font set comes with standard glyphs and ligatures. This font works fine with PC and Mac machines. The installation of this font set is also simple. The font can be accessed from design softwares like Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, and MS Word as well. The font set comes with PUA-encoded characters and These characters can be accessed without the need for additional softwares.  The font comes with lowercase, and uppercase letters, numerals, punctuation marks, etc., The font set provides multilingual support. 11. Aeloria Aeloria. Image Credit: Envato Elements The Aeloria is a vintage-style classic decorative font. This font is ideal for futuristic projects. This font can be used for logo brands, fantasy novels, games, designs of editorials, stationery, sports, blog, and modern advertising designs. It is an ideal font that can work for card invitations, home decorations, book titles, covers, special events, and much more. 12. Jazz Script Jazz Script. Image Credit: Envato Elements Jazz Script is a groovy font family that has two weights of the script. This font set has a detailed set of caps and extras that will help you to add value to the designs. This font set also helps you create custom letters with extra swashes.  This font set takes its motivation from the American lettering of the 1950s and 1960s. These fonts have grooves with sharp vector expressions. This font is a powerful tool to create symbolic headlines, packages, or logos. The script version of the font contains more than 700 glyphs. You can easily turn on the swash, contextual or tilting alternates.  You can manually select from the Glyph palette, even more, alternates to form more attractive font images. 13. Brioche Rustic Brioche. Image Credit: Design Cuts Brioche Rustic is a hand-lettered rustic serif font family that comes in four styles. The formatting type of this font includes regular, italics, bold, and outline.  This font set also has a set of ornate characters. You can also check the alternate characters on the capitals of A, J, K, and R letters to add value to your jazz project. The Brioche Rustic Serif Font comes in all capital letters. This gives you a high-end elegant look to your project. At the same time, you can use lowercase letters for a lovable look. This font family is the perfect fit for logos and branding projects. The font looks clean for print designs like magazines and flyers. This font can also work for various header elements and websites that might give you a plain and clumsy look. This font is ideal for farmhouse design projects, t-shirt designs, ornament designs, and much more. The font is available in uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and punctuation marks. This font is PUA encoded. 14. Narse Font Narse Font. Image Credit: Design Cuts Narse font is a font with a bold personality. This font is developed by Indieground design that is perfect for headings. This font set is made up of a square model design. It will give an excellent look with contemporary styling. This font set is ideal for any design project that requires a bold typography look. This font set takes its inspiration from Jazz cover art and modern lettering.  This font comes in .OTF  and .TTF file formats. This font set comes with all-caps font, and numerical characters. Each letter in this font does not come with sharp edges but comes with rounded edges.   15. Big Tickle The Big Tickle. Image Credit: Design Cuts Big Tickle font set reminds you of the jazz music of the 1950s and the Rock’n’Roll dances of the 1960s. At first, it reminds you of the Serif style, the font comes in a wide range of weights that can maintain an even color across different sizes. You can use it as a normal font or an all-caps font. You can play with the baseline of the font and give it more bounce to its composition. The alternates have every uppercase letter. This type of font version comes with the inner hatched and offset with shadow decoration. The second one is the script style of the font. They look like the ones signed with the brush. They can be used independently or along with the serif style of font.  The last type of font is the Retro Graphic. This style has a lot of design elements from the 1950s and 1960s. This set has the style of the poster, books, or ads. This helps you to create attractive retro-style fonts or use them independently. There are a total of 124 graphical elements in it. The font set comes with uppercase, lowercase letters, numerals, punctuation marks, etc.  You will be able to bring in an authentic feel of the mid-century modern adventure with this font set.  The font set comes with the .OTF file format.  The stylistic alternates that come with the font require the use of professional design softwares such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, or Inkscape. This font set also provides multilingual support. 16. Montreux Sans Pro Montreux Sans Pro. Image Credit: Design Cuts Montreux Sans Pro is the ultimate universal sans grotesk superfamily of 132 fonts. The font is inspired by the Swiss design, yet it appears distinct. The distinctive personality of the font is shown in the small modern and dynamic letterforms. The font set has a unique geometric approach in the way it displays its overall proportions.  This font set satisfies the need for modern brandings. It has a set of 80 ligatures that includes a broad selection of upper-case ligatures that can be used for modern-day logo designing and attractive headlines.  The font set consists of three main sub-families. They are Grotesk, Classic, and Jazz. All the subsets have their own soft versions with rounded corners. This will give the font a more soft and natural feel. This font set has got 132 styles, 11 weights, and web fonts. 17. Carlsons Carlsons. Image Credit: Design Cuts Carlson’s Typeface family is a set of ten fonts from Fabrica. This font design takes its inspiration from classic retro vintage matches. This font is the ideal choice for designing posters, logos designing, t-shirts, and magazine printings. The font style is eye-pleasing, typographic designs, and much more.  This font set has the .OTF, .TTF file formats.  18. Jazz Malino Playful Font Jazz Malino Playful Font. Image Credit: Creative Market Jazz Malino is a jazzy and playful font. This font set comes as a regular bold square display font. The font set features unique tilting, display text, random, and bouncy looks. This font is the ideal choice for branding, headings, invitations, event names, blog headings, social media, etc.,  This font comes with all uppercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and ligatures. The font set also provides you with multi-lingual support. 19. No Worries No Worries. Image Credit: Creative Market No Worries is a retro-style jazz font. The rounded edges of this font make this serif font offer an attractive look. The font set has a thick bold look that makes it the perfect choice for headliners. This font set has beautifully rounded corners and the corners are left with beautiful swashes as well. This display typeface is ideal for cartoon posters, graphics, logos, and much more. There are uppercase, lowercase letters, numerals, symbols, etc.  20. Klose Slab Klose Slab. Image Credit: Creative Market Klose Slab is a retro-style vintage typeface from Studio Sun. Klose Slab comes in four styles: expanded, semi-expanded, normal, and condensed. The width of the font can also be customized based on your requirements. It is perfect for logotype, headline texts, displayed texts, and much more. This font set supports more than 75 languages.  Our Favorite Jazz Fonts Still undecided? Check out our favorite jazz fonts below! Jazz Malino Playful Font Ecustic Quincy Jhons Oldiez Font Family Jazzbury Jazz Script Greatsby Brioche Rustic Serif Font Family Aeloria Zurika Carlsons Montreux Sans Pro Frequently Asked Questions What is the jazz font? Any font that has the scope of improvisation and innovations in them is a Jazz font. Name the Jazz font that is inspired by American advertising. Let's Jazz is a playful jazz font that is inspired by iconic American advertising. How to apply a cool jazz font? To easily install this exceptional font on your operating system, simply visit the download section of the website and click the provided link. Once downloaded, extract the zip file and open the extracted folder to complete the installation. Which of the Jazz font has a sense of nature and human touch in it? Quincy Jhons is a bold classic jazz font that comes with rounded corners that gives you a sense of nature and human touch in each letter. Best Jazz Fonts Summary Any design project requires high-quality images coupled with high-quality typefaces to make it successful. There are times you might feel frustrated with the fact that you are not able to find the best attractive and innovative typefaces for your design projects. With this list of the best jazz fonts, you can make your dream project successful and change the settings of your designs with these fonts. Make the best use of them and write your experiences with them in the comments section given below. Jazz music is the base of various other music genres like pop, blues, and rock. Jazz music has the quality of different rhythms, polished harmonies, and last but not least, the scope for improvisation. A jazz band consists of various musical instruments like bass, guitar, drums, keyboard, and lead vocals.

Jazz fonts are considered a cool type of font as there are various methods of improvisation with such font designs. If you are interested in spice up your typography, go through our posts on the best bohemian fonts and best california fonts.

Top 10+ Smooth Jazz Fonts for Creative Designs

Any font that has the scope of improvisation in them is a Jazz font. The following is the list of the best Jazz fonts available. Feel free to dive in and find out the details to help you continue creating stunning designs.

20+ Smooth Jazz Fonts for Jazzy Designs

1. Let’s make some Jazz 

Let’s Jazz is a playful jazz font that draws inspiration from iconic American advertising. This font has been created with the idea to pay homage to the dazzling graphics of the past. The result is this jazz typeface font that provides a condensed look with a bouncy beat.

Let’s Jazz will give a voluntary vibe to this amazing genre of music. This font has been created with powerful attention to the contrasting look of Saul Bass’s graphics. These graphics are ever-green and compelling.

There are two versions of the same font: The regular and the stamp. Each version of the font contains 450 glyphs and covers several languages in the Latin alphabet. The jazzy experience is expanded with the OpenType Support for small caps. These fonts include beautiful alternate ligatures but old-style retro-style fonts.

This font can be widely used in various design projects like headlines, packaging, logos, badges, and more. There is a bonus collection with various examples that are also included that will help you with the design projects.

This font style consists of .OTF, .AI, and .PNG file formats. This font provides multilingual support to central, eastern, and western European languages as well.

There are OpenType feature standard and discretionary ligatures, alternates, and small and capital letters with old-style numbers are also included. All the additional characters are also PUA encoded.

The additional character of this font can be copied directly from the FontBook of Mac and Character Map of Windows and pasted into your favorite text editor.

Oldiez Font Family is a retro vintage, classic, old-school jazz font. This is a hand-lettering font style. This font is the perfect choice for your branding invitation cards, labels, clothing company, vintage style font, etc.

All the above said types consist of lowercase, and uppercase letters, numbers, symbols, punctuation characters, and multilingual support.

Greatsby Typeface is a vintage serif display jazz font that is motivated by the retro-style novels of F. Scott Fitzgerald. The font style includes file in .TTF, .OTF, and .WOFF file formats.

This font consists of some pleasing ligatures and seductive swashes that are the perfect combination to spice up your existing or new designs. The seductive swashes can work as an addition to the already existing alphabets and make them look attractive. 

The font set comes as the regular style and alternative style font. Both these styles come in .TTF and .OTF file formats. There are commercial licenses, instant downloads and free updates available with the font.

Ecustic is a graceful-looking script jazz font. This font set belongs to the calligraphy style of fonts. The font looks great on greeting cards, branding materials, business cards, quotations, posters, and much more. 

The alternate characters of this font type are divided into various features such as stylistic sets, stylistic alternates, contextual alternates, SWASH, and ligatures. This font type belongs to the old-age Serif font family that is perfect for logos, greeting cards, quotations, branding, typography, envelope lettering, etc. This font can also serve for coffee bean advertising, packaging covers, labels, pamphlets, old-age wine bottle labels, etc.,

16. Montreux Sans Pro

Montreux Sans Pro is the ultimate universal sans grotesk superfamily of 132 fonts. The font is inspired by the Swiss design, yet it appears distinct. The distinctive personality of the font is shown in the small modern and dynamic letterforms. The font set has a unique geometric approach in the way it displays its overall proportions. 

This font set satisfies the need for modern brandings. It has a set of 80 ligatures that includes a broad selection of upper-case ligatures that can be used for modern-day logo designing and attractive headlines. 

The font set consists of three main sub-families. They are Grotesk, Classic, and Jazz. All the subsets have their own soft versions with rounded corners. This will give the font a more soft and natural feel.

This font set has got 132 styles, 11 weights, and web fonts.

17. Carlsons

Carlson’s Typeface family is a set of ten fonts from Fabrica. This font design takes its inspiration from classic retro vintage matches. This font is the ideal choice for designing posters, logos designing, t-shirts, and magazine printings. The font style is eye-pleasing, typographic designs, and much more. 

This font set has the .OTF, .TTF file formats. 

18. Jazz Malino Playful Font

Jazz Malino is a jazzy and playful font. This font set comes as a regular bold square display font. The font set features unique tilting, display text, random, and bouncy looks. This font is the ideal choice for branding, headings, invitations, event names, blog headings, social media, etc., 

This font comes with all uppercase letters, numerals, punctuations, and ligatures. The font set also provides you with multi-lingual support.

19. No Worries

No Worries is a retro-style jazz font. The rounded edges of this font make this serif font offer an attractive look. The font set has a thick bold look that makes it the perfect choice for headliners. This font set has beautifully rounded corners and the corners are left with beautiful swashes as well. This display typeface is ideal for cartoon posters, graphics, logos, and much more. There are uppercase, lowercase letters, numerals, symbols, etc. 

20. Klose Slab

Klose Slab is a retro-style vintage typeface from Studio Sun. Klose Slab comes in four styles: expanded, semi-expanded, normal, and condensed. The width of the font can also be customized based on your requirements. It is perfect for logotype, headline texts, displayed texts, and much more. This font set supports more than 75 languages.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the jazz font?

Any font that has the scope of improvisation and innovations in them is a Jazz font.

Name the Jazz font that is inspired by American advertising.

Let's Jazz is a playful jazz font that is inspired by iconic American advertising.

How to apply a cool jazz font?

To easily install this exceptional font on your operating system, simply visit the download section of the website and click the provided link. Once downloaded, extract the zip file and open the extracted folder to complete the installation.

Which of the Jazz font has a sense of nature and human touch in it?

Quincy Jhons is a bold classic jazz font that comes with rounded corners that gives you a sense of nature and human touch in each letter.
